decks.notes: This deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game, utilizing cards like Wasteland, Maze of Ith, and Rishadan Port to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy revolves around creating a powerful board presence with cards like Urza's Saga, Dark Depths, and Thespian's Stage while using Life from the Loam to repeatedly fetch lands from the graveyard. Sphere of Resistance and Swords to Plowshares help to further control the opponent's actions, while Crop Rotation and Expedition Map provide additional utility and flexibility in finding key lands.

The focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently combo off by casting multiple spells in a single turn to win the game. By utilizing cards like Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Dark Ritual to generate mana, along with cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill through the deck, the goal is to put Thassa's Oracle onto the battlefield and win the game on the spot. The deck also includes several protection spells such as Pact of Negation and Chancellor of the Annex to ensure the combo can go off uninterrupted.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga provide consistent artifact recursion and generation, while cards like Force of Will offer protection. The deck's fast mana base with cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal allows for early aggression with creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Patchwork Automaton. The synergy between artifacts and blue spells creates a powerful aggro strategy that can quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while quickly putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. Cards like Skyclave Apparition and Stoneforge Mystic help control the board, while Orcish Bowmasters and White Orchid Phantom deliver a fast clock. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value and gives the deck a longer game plan. With a mix of disruptive elements and powerful threats, this Death & Taxes deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through a combination of disruption and aggression.

This deck utilizes the Cephalid Breakfast combo to quickly mill out your opponent and win the game. By combining cards like Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Dread Return, you can set up a loop to mill cards from your library and bring back critical pieces like Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly. The deck also includes disruption and protection cards like Force of Will and Cabal Therapy to help you set up your combo and protect it from being disrupted by your opponent.

The core idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, while controlling the game with counterspells like Force of Will. The goal is to cheat in big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier with Show and Tell or Omniscience, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to react. The deck also includes cards like Veil of Summer to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The strategy relies on efficiently cheating in powerful creatures and spells to win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly bring out powerful creatures, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, by using Show and Tell to cheat them into play. The deck also utilizes Omniscience to cast spells for free, along with Stock Up to draw more cards and maintain consistency. Force of Will and Veil of Summer provide protection and disruption against opposing spells, while Lotus Petal helps ramp up mana quickly. The focus is on efficiently executing the combo and overwhelming the opponent with high impact creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly getting big creatures into play by utilizing the combo of Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The main goal is to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier as early as possible to overwhelm the opponent. Support cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Force of Will help to dig for combo pieces and protect the combo from disruption. The deck is designed to win the game in a few quick turns through explosive plays and high-powered creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize artifacts and aggressive creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By using cards like Chalice of the Void to lock out certain spells, Emry, Lurker of the Loch to recur artifacts, and Force of Will for protection, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence. Cards like Urza's Saga and Mox Opal help generate mana and provide additional synergies with artifacts, while Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer serve as powerful threats to close out the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to cheat out powerful threats like Solitude and Skyclave Apparition, you can control the board and chip away at your opponent's life total. Recruiter of the Guard and Yorion, Sky Nomad provide extra value and card advantage, ensuring that you can maintain tempo and outpace your opponent. With a mix of disruption, efficient creatures, and card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin, allowing for early deployment of powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Devourer of Destiny provide aggressive threats. The use of Wasteland and Wastes further disrupts opponents and ensures mana denial. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient Eldrazi creatures while controlling the board with disruptive spells and lands.

This Bant Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with a variety of powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. It also features cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Teferi, Time Raveler to generate card advantage and control the tempo of the game. Additionally, the deck includes counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its own game plan. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and disruption, this deck aims to control the game and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck aims to quickly disrupt and control the opponent's plays while maintaining a steady pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes a mix of powerful disruption spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying threats like Orcish Bowmasters, Murktide Regent, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to apply pressure and close out the game. The deck also includes various removal spells like Fatal Push and Baleful Strix to deal with opposing threats. The key strategy is to maintain tempo and control the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Witherbloom Command and Murktide Regent. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push to control the board. The mana denial strategy of Wasteland combined with the card advantage of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and draw spells like Brainstorm allows the deck to maintain tempo and outvalue the opponent. Overall, this deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent with a blend of aggro and midrange strategies.

The deck revolves around controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Quantum Riddler. Leyline Binding provides additional control elements, while cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath offer a win condition and life gain. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three colors effectively, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. Ultimately, the goal is to out-value the opponent and control the tempo of the game until victory is achieved.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game through efficient counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage provided by Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Back to Basics and Swords to Plowshares, while also applying pressure with Murktide Regent and Thundertrap Trainer. The inclusion of versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Spell Pierce allows the player to adapt to various threats and game situations. The deck's mana base is designed to support its diverse spell lineup and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors.
